meanings.definition: To make (something) known to the public.
meanings.sent1: The company publicises its new products through social media.
meanings.sent2: The local bakery publicises its daily specials with colorful signs.
meanings.sent3: The cat publicises its hunger by meowing loudly at the kitchen door.
meanings.sent4: The rising sun publicises the start of a new day with its warm glow.
meanings.sent5: The teacher publicises the upcoming test to ensure all students are prepared.

meanings.definition: To promote or advertise (something) to the general public.
meanings.sent1: The charity publicises its fundraising event to gather support.
meanings.sent2: The movie studio publicises its latest blockbuster with trailers and posters.
meanings.sent3: The clown publicises his comedy show by juggling colorful balls on the street.
meanings.sent4: The lighthouse publicises its presence to ships with its powerful beam of light.
meanings.sent5: The politician publicises her campaign promises to win the trust of voters.
